pt: {sc}laughable{/sc} {sc}ludicrous{/sc} {sc}ridiculous{/sc} {sc}comic{/sc} {sc}comical{/sc} mean provoking laughter or mirth. {sc}laughable{/sc} applies to anything occasioning laughter.
{sc}ludicrous{/sc} suggests absurdity that excites both laughter and scorn.
{sc}ridiculous{/sc} suggests extreme absurdity, foolishness, or contemptibility.
{sc}comic{/sc} applies especially to what arouses thoughtful amusement.
{sc}comical{/sc} applies to what arouses spontaneous hilarity.

quotes.t: It was absurd for him to paint portraits for pay, and {qword}ridiculous{/qword} to paint them for nothing; so he did not paint them at all.
I also poked fun at those {qword}ridiculous{/qword} fins on the '59 Cadillac. The '60, now, that was something else, and I've thought highly enough of the design to have owned two of them.
His band mates take the stage in {qword}ridiculous{/qword} elf costumes—black tights, pointy felt hats.
Take into account the artist's intention and choice of means. This sounds so elementary that it seems {qword}ridiculous{/qword} to bring it up …

et: Latin {it}ridiculosus{/it} (from {it}ridiculum{/it} jest, from neuter of {it}ridiculus{/it}) or {it}ridiculus{/it}, literally, laughable, from {it}ridēre{/it} to laugh
shortdef: arousing or deserving ridicule : extremely silly or unreasonable : absurd, preposterous
